oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-05-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 4, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Ernest Tubb mentions that Grand Ole Opry Week begins the next day (May 5, 1957). It is announced that this is the 917th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Old Hickory Singers; Hank Locklin; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- The Women Make A Fool Out Of Me (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Are You From Dixie (Old Hickory Singers) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Hank Locklin -- A Good Woman's Love (Hank Locklin) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ernest Tubb, Hank Locklin) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Arkansas Traveler (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- What A Friend We Have In Jesus (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Chet Atkins -- Cruising Down The River (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Old Hickory Singers; Jackson, Tommy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Byrd, Billy; Locklin, Hank
